value.title: Become Better with DAX- No More Struggles!
value.excerpt: Learn how to create advanced DAX calculations by mastering the fundamentals.

topItems.title: How to Use CALCULATE in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This is one of the most import function to master in Power BI. You can filter your data and create complex measure such as year over year comparisons with ease with these easy to follow tutorial. More more help this function.
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/B6w0IeLMZok" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Year over Year and Month over Month Calculations in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to quickly produce time intelligence calcution in Power BI using these easy to follow DAX equations. Elevate your time series analysis.
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/80i8rLQtO3o" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: DAX Table Functions: ALL, FILTER, & VALUES
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate DAX Table functions in Power BI with real world scenarios. Also learn how to quickly add these functions in to dynamic calculations in DAX.
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/n-yO6WXE880" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to quickly use the CALCULATE function to get total from year to date, month to date and quarter to date in Power BI using a Calendar table and time intelligence functions in DAX.
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qiLjmKoP9ag" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Wednesday with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to my new Power BI DAX Series. Every Wednesday, we will talk about different DAX functions.

topItems.title: DAX Functions Overview - Date and Time Function in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Welcome to my new series – “Wednesday with DAX”. This is the first video of this series. The first episode covers all Date and Time functions used in Power BI In this video, we will talk about Date and Time functions in Power BI. We will discuss about most useful date and time functions in Power BI.

topItems.title: DAX for Power BI - Calculate Cumulative Sum (Running Total) of Count in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: The cumulative total is also known as Running total and during this video, we will talk about how we can calculate a cumulative sum for request count using Power BI Dax measure in Power BI. topItems.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
topItems.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common. value.title: Using Power BI gateways to connect to data sources
value.excerpt: Learn all about the On-Premises Data Gateway and how it is used with the Power BI service. The Power BI gateway can be used to refresh imported data as well as allow you to use DirectQuery or connect live to an Analysis Services mode.

topItems.title: Get started with the Power BI Gateway
topItems.excerpt: Get to know what the Power BI Gateway is along with how to get it setup for scheduled refresh of imported data.  Free Gateway Cube Sheet: https://guyinacu.be/gatewaystartpdf  Gateway Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-onprem  Gateway sizing: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/gateway-onprem-sizing

topItems.title: Previous year up to a certain date
topItems.excerpt: This video describes how to compute previous year values up to a certain date in DAX and Power BI. This technique is useful in case the data is presenting incomplete months or years. topItems.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. topItems.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?
